article.class: post-124 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

div.p: Emergency and school closure information is posted to the local media via the FlashAlert system (see the window below). In the event that school is closed or delayed due to inclement weather, the district’s emergency notification system will call parents at their home number around 6:00 a.m. to announce late start or closure information. If snow routes are in effect, the message will indicate so. Emails and text messages are sent as well.
If no announcement is made, bus routes and pickups will run as usual. Parents are asked to refrain from calling the district office or schools as high call volumes can shut down the phone system.

h4.strong: Inclement Weather Two-Hour Delay Additional Info

div.p: If a two-hour delay is implemented on a Wednesday, scheduled early release will be canceled, and students will finish the day as if it were a regular day. In the event of a two-hour delay:

ul.li: Students should arrive at their bus stops two hours later than they normally arrive, but please allow for delays.
There will be no AM preschool.
Extended Day will open at 8:30 a.m.
There will be no Cascadia Tech a.m. bus service. If Evergreen School District is operating on time, Cascadia Tech will be on time as well.
There will be no zero period classes.

h4.strong: Inclement Weather: Open, Late, or Closed?

div.p: On a morning when the threat of hazardous conditions may exist, district staff members begin driving bus routes around 4:00 a.m. to examine road conditions. We consider weather-related situations that students and staff will face as well as the forecast for later in the day. We also monitor the road conditions through our county’s web site. Our school district covers a large region with remote areas and steep terrain in places. While roads may be passable in town, conditions may be very different just a few miles away—in fact, the elevation within the district boundaries varies from 50 to 2,000+ feet. Before we close schools or delay start times, we seek answers to the questions below:

ul.li: Can we ensure that buses are able to navigate the streets safely?
Will students be safe waiting for buses, driving, or walking to school?
What are the predicted weather conditions later in the school day so we can also ensure students a safe return home?
If we start school late (e.g., two-hour late start), will road conditions be substantially improved?

div.p: Once the information is gathered, the superintendent makes the decision whether or not to close or delay school. When the decision to close schools or delay the start times is made, we inform parents, students, and staff. Emergency and school closure information is communicated to the local media via the FlashAlert system, and the district web site will display the information sent to the media around 5:00 a.m.

As a parent, you may decide to keep your child or children at home if you feel it’s not safe to make the trip to school. You are in the best position to decide about your local conditions and your child’s judgment and driving capabilities.

While we go to extensive measures to determine if roads district-wide are safe for travel, it’s physically impossible for us to be on every street corner and side street at all times. We rely on you to be the final judge when it comes to the safety of your child.

p.strong: *This information is updated in November of each school year*

div.p: If no announcement is made, bus routes will run on their regular schedule, but please allow for delays. If a two-hour late start is announced, buses will run regular routes two hours later than the normal schedule, and there will be no AM preschool. We appreciate your support in keeping students safe. In the event snow routes are announced in the morning, buses will also run on snow routes in the afternoon.
div.h4: Snow Route Information for students who live on Livingston Mountain and ride the following routes:
div.p: Buses 1-B, 11-A, 66-A, 67-B: Students accessing service on NE Livingston Rd & NE Hancock Rd will board the bus at the Fire District 9 Station located on NE 292nd Ave. Students accessing service NW 262nd Ave, will load and unload at NE Bradford Road & 262nd Ave.
Buses 15-B, 68-A: Students accessing service on NE Winters Rd & the Jones Creek area will load and unload at the intersection of NE Lessard Rd & Winters Rd.
div.h4: Snow Route information for students who live in town and ride the following routes:
div.p: Buses 62-A, 84-A, 87-B, 90-A: Students accessing service at NW 11th Ave & Cascade, NW 11th & Elliott, 9th & Elliott, NW Goldendale & 9th Ave or NW 9th & Hoquiam, or NW Freemont & NW 9th Ave will load and unload at NW 11th Ave & NW McIntosh or NW 9th Ave & Klickitat or NW Freemont & McIntosh.

Buses 17-A, 52-A, 54-B, 60-B, 71-A, 74-A, 82-B, 87-A, 89-B: Students accessing service at LeBrun Dr & N 3rd St and all of the Lookout Ridge area will load and unload at Lookout Ridge & 10th St or Lookout Ridge & 8th St.

Buses 10-B, 26-A, 70-B: Students accessing service at 1133 NW 44th Ave or NW 43rd Ave & Ivy St. will load and unload at 1405 NW 44th Ave @ roundabout. Students accessing service on Lacamas Lane will load and unload at NW 35th & Jasmine.
Buses 60-A, 80-B, 81-A: Students accessing service at NW 29th Ave & Dahlia St, will load and unload at NW 29th Ave & Benita St.

Buses 4-A, 51-A, 58-B: Students accessing service at SE Grandridge Dr & Goodwin Loop, SE Deerfern Loop & Deerfern St, SE Fernridge Dr & Fernridge Ct or NW 12th Ave & Whitman St will load and unload at SE Grandridge & Fernridge Dr or NW Whitman St & 16th Cir.
Buses 53-B, 62-A, 86-A: Students accessing service at the NW Ilwaco St turnaround and in the Ilwaco St area will load and unload at NW McIntosh Rd & Ilwaco St.

Buses 63-A, 70-A, 80-B: Students accessing service at NW 23rd Ave & Hood Dr, NW Hood Dr & Hood St, NW Hood St & 20th Cir, or NW Hood St & Columbia Summit will load and unload at NW 23rd Ave & Douglas or NW 18th St & Cascade St
Buses 26-B, 53-A, 84-B, 92-A: Students accessing service in The Glen neighborhood will load and unload at SE 196th Ave & 35th Way.
Bus 1-A, 26-A, 70-B: Students accessing service at NE 35th & Franklin will load and unload at NE Everett St & NE 35th Ave
Bus 17-B: Students accessing service at NW 38th Ave & Oregon St or NW 40th Ave & Currawong Ct, will load and unload at NW Sierra Dr & 38th Ave or NW Sierra Dr & 41st Cir.
Buses 67-A, 93-A: Students accessing services at NW Ivy Lane & NW 30th Ave, or NW 32nd Ave & Kent St will load and unload at NW Kent St & NW 28th Ave.
Buses 69-A, 90-B: Students accessing services along NW Larkspur St or at NW Klickitat St & 17th Ave will load and unload at NW Maryland & NW 24th Ave.
Bus 51-A, Students accessing services along NW Klickitat & NW 17th Ave will load and unload at NW 16th Ave & NW Klickitat St.
Bus 26-A: Students accessing services at NW 40th Ave & NW Currawong Ct will load and unload at NW Sierra Dr & NW 40th Ave.

p.em: Legend: “A” routes are High School/ Middle School; “B” routes are Elementary
